extends AbstractSatSolver<org.sat4j.specs.ISolver>

    Timo Günther

      • isSatisfiable

        public boolean isSatisfiable()
        Description copied from interface: SatSolver

        Returns true iff the problem is satisfiable.

        More formally, let f denote the current (possibly empty) problem. Those are all the clauses that have been added to the problem. f is a conjunction of n ≥ 0 CNF clauses fi. Each clause fi in turn consists of a positive amount of possibly negated literals fij:

        f = f1 ∧ … ∧ fn
          = (f11 ∨ … ∨ f1m) ∧ … ∧ (fn1 ∨ … ∨ fnk)
        Then, f is satisfiable iff there is a variable assignment that satisfies f (i.e. makes it evaluate to true). Such an assignment is called model.
        Returns:
        whether the problem is satisfiable

                                                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Returns:

        Throws:
